vulnerability_findings.name: controlled-delegatecall
vulnerability_findings.message:
LightContract.fallback (LightContract.sol#15-17) uses delegatecall to a input-controlled function id
	require(bool)(lib.delegatecall(msg.data)) (LightContract.sol#16)

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in LightContract.fallback (LightContract.sol#15-17):
	-require(bool)(lib.delegatecall(msg.data)) LightContract.sol#16

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_library' of LightContract. (LightContract.sol#11) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: Delegatecall to user-supplied address (SWC 112)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The contract delegates execution to another contract with a user-supplied address.
The smart contract delegates execution to a user-supplied address.This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of this contract account and manipulate the state of the contract account or execute actions on its behalf.
Classification: SWC-112
